Western Copper acknowledges and agrees that a breach of its covenants contained
in this Agreement would result in damage to Glamis that could not adequately be compensated
for by monetary award alone, Accordingly, Western Copper agrees that in the event of any such
breach, in addition to any other remedies available to Glamis at law or otherwise, Glamis will be
entitled, as a matter of right and without the need to prove damage, to apply to a court of
competent jurisdiction for relief by way of injunction, restraining order, decree or otherwise as
may be appropriate to ensure compliance by Western Copper with the provisions of this
Agreement and to restrain any breach of this Agreement by Western Copper, Any remedy
expressly set forth in this ยง3.1 wall be in addition to and not inclusive of or dependent upon the
exercise of any other remedy available to Glamis at law or otherwise.
perturbation.changed_text:
Western Copper acknowledges and agrees that a breach of its covenants contained
in this Agreement would result in damage to Glamis. Accordingly, Western Copper agrees that in the event of any such
breach, in addition to any other remedies available to Glamis at law or otherwise, Glamis will be
entitled to apply to a court of
competent jurisdiction for relief by way of injunction, restraining order, decree or otherwise as
may be appropriate to ensure compliance by Western Copper with the provisions of this
Agreement and to restrain any breach of this Agreement by Western Copper, Any remedy
expressly set forth in this ยง3.1 wall be in addition to and not inclusive of or dependent upon the

perturbation.explanation: Removing the phrase 'that could not adequately be compensated for by monetary award alone' and 'as a matter of right and without the need to prove damage' weakens the enforceability of the remedies. It introduces ambiguity about whether monetary damages would be sufficient and removes the explicit waiver of the need to prove damages for injunctive relief.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Specific performance and injunctive relief principles.

perturbation.original_text:
4.8 This Agreement will be governed exclusively by and construed in accordance
with the laws of the Province of British Columbia, and the parties attorn to the exclusive
jurisdiction of the Courts of British Columbia.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.8 This Agreement will be governed by the laws of the Province of British Columbia, but in the event of a dispute, the parties may agree to resolve the dispute in a jurisdiction they deem fit.
perturbation.explanation: The alteration introduces a contradiction. Initially, the agreement specifies that it will be exclusively governed by British Columbia law and its courts. However, the added clause allows the parties to choose a different jurisdiction for dispute resolution. This contradicts the exclusivity of the initial clause, potentially leading to confusion and disputes over which jurisdiction's laws should apply.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Choice of Law and Jurisdiction clauses.

perturbation.original_text:
4.5 No waiver of any provision of this Agreement shall be binding on any of the
parties hereto unless consented to in writing by such party. No waiver of any provision of this
Agreement by either of the parties hereto shall constitute a waiver of any other provision, nor
shall any waiver constitute a continuing waiver unless otherwise clearly provided.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.5 No waiver of any provision of this Agreement shall be binding on any of the
parties hereto unless consented to in writing by such party. No waiver of any provision of this
Agreement by either of the parties hereto shall constitute a waiver of any other provision. The parties may verbally agree to waive any provision to this agreement, regardless of anything written to the contrary.
perturbation.explanation: The clause initially protects against implied waivers and necessitates written consent. The introduced sentence directly contradicts this by permitting verbal waivers. This contradiction undermines the certainty and enforceability of the written agreement, as verbal agreements are often difficult to prove and can lead to disputes over whether a waiver was actually intended.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Waiver and Modification of Contract clauses.
